label: Confirmation of Enrolment (CoE)
what_it_proves: Demonstrates that you are enrolled in a registered course with a current CRICOS-registered provider, which is a pre-condition for the Student visa and supports your genuine student intent by anchoring you to a specific, approved course.
examples: CoE letter issued by the university or college listing your course name, CRICOS code, commencement date, and duration
common_gaps: CoE issued before course has been formally confirmed — reissue required if course details change
CoE for a different course than the one being applied for
CoE issued more than 12 months before application submission without explanation
No CRICOS code visible on the document

legal_basis.citation: Schedule 2, clause 500.215 — ESOS Act enrolment requirement

label: Approved English Language Test Result
what_it_proves: Demonstrates you meet the English proficiency threshold for your course type and provider. Accepted tests include IELTS Academic, TOEFL iBT, PTE Academic, Cambridge C1 Advanced / C2 Proficiency, and OET.
examples: IELTS Academic Test Report Form (TRF) with overall band score and all sub-scores visible
TOEFL iBT score report from ETS with My Best Scores or single-sitting scores
PTE Academic Score Report from Pearson
Cambridge C1 Advanced or C2 Proficiency Certificate of Results
OET Result Letter (for health professions pathway)
common_gaps: Test result more than 3 years old at the expected date of decision — rebook required
Using IELTS General Training instead of IELTS Academic
Sub-band score below minimum even when overall score passes — all bands must individually meet threshold
No test booking made yet — creates timeline risk if result takes 2–4 weeks
PTE or TOEFL scores not meeting all sub-score minimums (listening, reading, writing, speaking treated separately)

legal_basis.series: Migration (LIN 19/051 — English Language Requirements for the Student Visa) Instrument 2019
legal_basis.citation: LIN 19/051 — approved test types and minimum scores
